title: Boards Update: The Rant Board is now live!
body:
Hello everyone! 

We have been taking in a lot of feedback for awhile now, specifically about low effort/rant-like posts being made in places like **Player Behavior** and (mostly) **Gameplay**, which hinders the Boards experience for a lot of users. We understand users get frustrated and need a place to vent about their frustrations to the game. Because of this, we have added a new sub-board to the Boards!

Introducing; the **RANT** board. (~~Which stands for Rambling At New Things not really thought it was clever though~~.) Have a frustration about the game? Want to scream your head off about Riot nerfing your main? Want to scream about how broken Yasuo is? Well, the rant board is the place for you! Please remember to read the Rant Board rules however before posting! We will also be redirecting a lot of spam/ranty posts from **Gameplay** to **Rant** now that we have this Board.

* [Here is the link to the Rant Board!](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/rant)
* [Here is the link to the Rant Board rules!](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/rant/ikMnJcs2-rant-board-rules) (which you should read before posting)

If threads posted to Gameplay are actually being deleted and the poster instructed to repost their content to Rants instead, then this really is identical to the failed experiment of G+, only now mods are being honest instead of tactful. When you have one board where people are encouraged to post crap and another where low-quality content is forbidden, it doesn't matter whether you call the former Gameplay and the latter Gameplay+ or the former Rants and the latter Gameplay.

Mods, your logic is flawed.

There's a huge difference in execution between the Gameplay+ and Gameplay, and Gameplay and RANT.

Gameplay+ was only high-quality posts. This meant moderator approval and shit. Rants is for actual low-quality rants.

In both cases, moderate quality posts stayed in Gameplay. This just means you don't have to sift through shit to find decent but not great ideas. Instead, **all** of the shit is gone from gameplay (although there might be bad ideas, there's no longer going to be blatant shitposts along the lines of "REMOV YASOU W PASSIVE E AND MAKE R DEAL 534% OF HIS MAX HEALTH IN PURE DAMAGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!11")

G+ was created so that people would have a place to read worthwhile posts without having to sift through garbage. Rants was created so that people would have a place to read worthwhile posts without having to sift through garbage. The inescapable fact is that many people are interested in posting garbage, and not all of those people realize their posts are garbage.

This is just part of the knee-jerk initiative to save Boards from being "useless," anyway (although I totally understand where mods are coming from on that, and I don't blame them).

Just to clarify; Rant was created so people could vent frustrations there without creating a toxic environment for the rest of the board. And I reassure you, Rant is much more self-sustainable than G+.

The reason G+ shut down isn't because we were lazy or that we were being stubborn, but when in a day you get 5 G+ submissions, and 3 of them is a one sentence "fuck riot" comment, it was hard to actually promote good posts when we barely got any/got spammed with a lot of low-effort threads.

Well from a psychological POV, some people just need a place to write out their feelings. I often make super long replies when I'm angry and then delete them or put them somewhere and read it later. I often find I was clearly wayyy too angry to think rationally. Posts that are literally just hate threads shouldn't be replied to imo, unless you want to rant with them, then just make your own rant. It's good to get your feelings out when you're angry. Rant threads aren't very productive. The millions of Yasuo threads get nothing done for example, despite the tons of comments of people hating with them. Like they're just not in a headspace that's worth discussion you know what I'm saying?

Rant threads aren't very productive. The millions of Yasuo threads get nothing done for example, despite the tons of comments of people hating with them. Like they're just not in a headspace that's worth discussion you know what I'm saying?

The problem is as a community, we don't want people to feel like they're being ignored or censored. Maybe some people do just rant to get out their frustration but a lot of people actually want to talk about their frustration with other people. By essentially locking the topic and moving it to an archived board, you're shutting them down. Having your topic moved to the Rant board shouldn't necessarily feel like a punishment but that is what will happen if we don't allow people to reply to a user's topics. The person will feel like they're being ignored and I think overall this will hurt the community. 

The Gameplay board shouldn't be cluttered with people ranting about their hate for a champion or why a champion is busted but for that to not happen, people need a board where they can rant about stuff like this with other people and feel like they're reaching an audience. The Rants board is great for that but it needs to allow people to reply for posters to feel like their voice is heard and ultimately for the board to be successful at it's intended purpose.
If they want to discuss their frustration, then they should make an intelligent post with logical follow through and evidence, not just one that relies on rage and ignores facts.

I get that argument, but I feel RANT should be a bit more than just a dumping ground for poor quality gameplay threads. RANT threads don't show up on the front page (and should stay that way, in my opinion) so I don't see how big of a harm allowing replies would be, so that angry people can vent and feel like they're not just shouting into a pillow. 
Right now I can definitely see how someone who's mad at Yasuo or something has no reason to put their thread on RANT so they'll probably just put it on gameplay anyway, so there's not much progress to be made. But I feel like if discussion on RANT is allowed it'll potentially improve discussion on the gameplay boards as well, since angry people who just want to vent and have their voice heard will naturally move to RANT (either through having their thread moved or having the outrage community commute there over time) and gameplay can be actual gameplay discussion again.

Right now RANT just feels like a thread graveyard, and really doesn't accomplish much more than that.
